reason: Move to the tape first, as it is positioned close to the target apple and may block grasping if not cleared.
Lower the arm to the working height to prepare for pulling the tape away from the target.
Pull the tape toward the robot base to move it away from the target apple area.
Lift the arm to a safe height after clearing the tape, preparing to move to the next obstacle.
Move to the pear, which is another obstacle near the target apple that needs to be cleared.
Lower the arm to the working height to prepare for pulling the pear away from the target.
Pull the pear toward the robot base to clear it from the target apple area.
Lift the arm to a safe height after clearing the pear, preparing to approach the target for grasping.
Reset the hand to the default open posture to ensure proper finger configuration before grasping.
The tape and pear have been cleared from near the target. Attempt to grasp the apple now.
Lift the arm to confirm the apple has been successfully picked up.
The target (apple) has been successfully grasped. The task is complete.
